poem:
Title: Ripples in the Morning Paper

Chop of news bites, a distant war story brews,
in Gaza, voices echo of threats anew.
The broadcaster crackles, soldier stands askew,
a night cabinet whispers, behind iron's view.
Separate worlds, tethered by thin ink queues,
yet, in every cup of tea, a reflection ensues.
How human lives buzz out in radio news,
like brief interruptions of the morning's dew.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Middle East crisis live: Israel says investigation into its air strike that killed aid workers in Gaza to take weeks 2.59pm BST In Israel, public broadcaster Kan is reporting that IDF spokesperson Daniel Hagari is considering whether to give a public broadcast tonight concerning preparations for an increased threat from Iran. Benjamin Netanyahu’s war cabinet is also expected to meet tonight. 2.56pm BST There is a little more detail on the statement from Hamas official". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Middle East crisis live: Israel says investigation into its air strike that killed aid workers in Gaza to take weeks 2.59pm BST In Israel, public broadcaster Kan is reporting that IDF spokesperson Daniel Hagari is considering whether to give a public broadcast tonight concerning preparations for an increased threat from Iran. Benjamin Netanyahu’s war cabinet is also expected to meet tonight. 2.56pm BST There is a little more detail on the statement from Hamas official
